Description: Head of terracotta figure of man. A head broken from a figure of a man, tending towards the grotesque, apparently shaven, but perhaps with a small beard. He has a large sidelock, and wears lotus buds on top of his head. Hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous red-brown Nile silt with a grey core.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Bibliog. Fischer 1994: 233, no. 464.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3190)
